content: Is the #[stable] attribute only able to be used for the upcoming release, or can it be used to prospectively stabilize something in a future release? I ask because I think the int_roundings feature is likely uncontroversial (minus the one discussion in the tracking issue), but unquestionably needs more time to let the inherent-over-trait method resolution settle by users upgrading num-integer. Is is possible to prospectively stabilize these in say, 1.59 (released 2022-02-24), or does this actually have to wait until 1.59 hits nightly? Asking both from a technical (does the attribute support this) and logistical (can/should we do this) perspective.
Placed this in #t-libs because the attribute is on library items. Happy to move to #t-compiler if desired.
